org.eclipse.californium.core

Class CoapResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.californium.core.CoapResource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConcurrentCoapResource, DiscoveryResource

    public class CoapResource
extends Object
implements Resource
    CoapResource is a basic implementation of a resource. Extend this class to write your own resources. Instances of type or subtype of CoapResource can be built up to a tree very easily, see add(CoapResource).

    CoapResource uses four distinct methods to handle requests: handleGET(), handlePOST(), handlePUT() and handleDELETE(). Each method has a default implementation that responds with a 4.05 (Method Not Allowed). Each method exists twice but with a different parameter: handleGET(Exchange) and handleGET(CoAPExchange) for instance. The class Exchange is used internally in Californium to keep the state of an exchange of CoAP messages. Only override this version of the method if you need to access detailed information of an exchange. Most developer should rather override the latter version. CoAPExchange provides a save and user-friendlier API that can be used to respond to a request.

    The following example override the four handle-method. 

     public class CoAPResourceExample extends CoapResource {
 
   public CoAPResourceExample(String name) {
     super(name);
   }
 
   public void handleGET(CoapExchange exchange) {
     exchange.respond("hello world");
   }
 
   public void handlePOST(CoapExchange exchange) {
     exchange.accept();
 
     List<String> queries = exchange.getRequestOptions().getURIQueries();
     // ...
     exchange.respond(ResponseCode.CREATED);
   }
 
   public void handlePUT(CoapExchange exchange) {
     // ...
     exchange.respond(ResponseCode.CHANGED);
     changed(); // notify all observers
   }
 
   public void handleDELETE(CoapExchange exchange) {
     delete();
     exchange.respond(ResponseCode.DELETED);
   }
 }

    Each resource is allowed to define its own executor. When a request arrives, the request will be handled by the resource's executor. If a resource does not define its own executor, the executor of its parent or transitively an ancestor will be used. If no ancestor up to the root defines its own executor, the thread that delivers the request will invoke the handling method.

    CoapResource supports CoAP's observe mechanism. Enable a CoapResource to be observable by a CoAP client by marking it as observable with setObservable(boolean). Notify all CoAP observers by calling changed(). The method changed() reprocesses the requests from the observing clients that have originally established the observe relation. If the resource or one of its ancestors define an executor, the reprocessing is done on the executor. A CoAP observe relation between this resource and a CoAP client is represented by an instance of ObserveRelation.

    In contrast the class ResourceObserver has nothing to do with CoAP's observe mechanism but is an implementation of the general observe-pattern. A ResourceObserver is invoked whenever the name or path of a resource changes, when a child resource is added or removed or when a CoAP observe relation is added or canceled. // TODO: make example with createClient().get()

    • Method Detail

      • handleRequest

        public void handleRequest(Exchange exchange)
        Handles any request in the given exchange. By default it responds with a 4.05 (Method Not Allowed). Override this method if your resource handler requires advanced access to the internal Exchange class. Most developer should be better off with overriding the called methods handleGET(CoapExchange), handlePOST(CoapExchange), handlePUT(CoapExchange), and handleDELETE(CoapExchange), which provide a better API through the CoapExchange class.
        Specified by:
        handleRequest in interface Resource
        Parameters:
        exchange - the exchange with the request

      • handleGET

        public void handleGET(CoapExchange exchange)
        Handles the GET request in the given CoAPExchange. By default it responds with a 4.05 (Method Not Allowed). Override this method to respond differently to GET requests. Possible response codes for GET requests are Content (2.05) and Valid (2.03).
        Parameters:
        exchange - the CoapExchange for the simple API

      • handlePOST

        public void handlePOST(CoapExchange exchange)
        Handles the POST request in the given CoAPExchange. By default it responds with a 4.05 (Method Not Allowed). Override this method to respond differently to POST requests. Possible response codes for POST requests are Created (2.01), Changed (2.04), and Deleted (2.02).
        Parameters:
        exchange - the CoapExchange for the simple API

      • handlePUT

        public void handlePUT(CoapExchange exchange)
        Handles the PUT request in the given CoAPExchange. By default it responds with a 4.05 (Method Not Allowed). Override this method to respond differently to PUT requests. Possible response codes for PUT requests are Created (2.01) and Changed (2.04).
        Parameters:
        exchange - the CoapExchange for the simple API

      • handleDELETE

        public void handleDELETE(CoapExchange exchange)
        Handles the DELETE request in the given CoAPExchange. By default it responds with a 4.05 (Method Not Allowed). Override this method to respond differently to DELETE requests. The response code to a DELETE request should be a Deleted (2.02).
        Parameters:
        exchange - the CoapExchange for the simple API

      • handleFETCH

        public void handleFETCH(CoapExchange exchange)
        Handles the FETCH request in the given CoAPExchange. By default it responds with a 4.05 (Method Not Allowed). Override this method to respond differently to FETCH requests. The response code to a FETCH request should be a Content (2.05).
        Parameters:
        exchange - the CoapExchange for the simple API

      • handlePATCH

        public void handlePATCH(CoapExchange exchange)
        Handles the PATCH request in the given CoAPExchange. By default it responds with a 4.05 (Method Not Allowed). Override this method to respond differently to PATCH requests. The response code to a PATCH requests are Created (2.01) and Changed (2.04).
        Parameters:
        exchange - the CoapExchange for the simple API

      • checkObserveRelation

        public void checkObserveRelation(Exchange exchange,
                        Response response)
        This method is used to apply resource-specific knowledge on the exchange. If the request was successful, it sets the Observe option for the response. It is important to use the notificationOrderer of the resource here. Further down the layer, race conditions could cause local reordering of notifications. If the response has an error code, no observe relation can be established and if there was one previously it is canceled. When this resource allows to be observed by clients and the request is a GET request with an observe option, the ServerMessageDeliverer already created the relation, as it manages the observing endpoints globally.
        Parameters:
        exchange - the exchange
        response - the response

      • createClient

        public CoapClient createClient()
        Creates a CoapClient that uses the same executor as this resource and one of the endpoints that this resource belongs to. If no executor is defined by this resource or any parent, the client will not have an executor (it still works). If this resource is not yet added to a server or the server has no endpoints, the client has no specific endpoint and will use Californium's default endpoint.
        Returns:
        the CoAP client

      • createClient

        public CoapClient createClient(URI uri)
        Creates a CoapClient that uses the same executor as this resource and one of the endpoints that this resource belongs to. If no executor is defined by this resource or any parent, the client will not have an executor (it still works). If this resource is not yet added to a server or the server has no endpoints, the client has no specific endpoint and will use Californium's default endpoint.
        Parameters:
        uri - the uri
        Returns:
        the CoAP client

      • createClient

        public CoapClient createClient(String uri)
        Creates a CoapClient that uses the same executor as this resource and one of the endpoints that this resource belongs to. If no executor is defined by this resource or any parent, the client will not have an executor (it still works). If this resource is not yet added to a server or the server has no endpoints, the client has no specific endpoint and will use Californium's default endpoint.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Adds the specified resource as child. Note that the resource should set the correct path of the child when added.

      • add

        public CoapResource add(CoapResource child)
        Adds the specified resource as child. This method is syntactic sugar to have a fluent-interface when adding resources to a tree. For instance, consider the following example: 
         server.add(
   new CoapResource("foo")
     .add(new CoapResource("a")
       .add(new CoapResource("a1"))
       .add(new CoapResource("a2"))
       .add(new CoapResource("a3"))
       .add(new CoapResource("a4"))
     )
     .add(new CoapResource("b")
       .add(new CoapResource("b1")
     )
   )
 );
        Parameters:
        child - the child to add
        Returns:
        this

      • add

        public CoapResource add(CoapResource... children)
        Adds the specified resource as child. This method is syntactic sugar to have a fluent-interface when adding resources to a tree. For instance, consider the following example: 
         server.add(
   new CoapResource("foo").add(
     new CoapResource("a").add(
       new CoapResource("a1"),
       new CoapResource("a2"),
       new CoapResource("a3"),
       new CoapResource("a4")
     ),
     new CoapResource("b").add(
       new CoapResource("b1")
     )
   )
 );
        Parameters:
        children - the child(ren) to add
        Returns:
        this

      • isCachable

        public boolean isCachable()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Checks if is the URI of the resource can be cached. If another request with the same destination URI arrives, it can be forwarded to this resource right away instead of traveling through the resource tree looking for it.
        Specified by:
        isCachable in interface Resource
        Returns:
        true, if this resource's URI is cachable

      • getPath

        public String getPath()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Gets the path to the resource which is equal to the URI of its parent plus a slash. Note that that the name of a resource is not part of its path but instead it holds that getURI().equals(getPath() + getName()).
        Specified by:
        getPath in interface Resource
        Returns:
        the path

      • setPath

        public void setPath(String path)
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Sets the path of the resource. Note that changing the path of a resource also changes the path of all its children.
        Specified by:
        setPath in interface Resource
        Parameters:
        path - the new path

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Sets the name of the resource. Note that changing the name of a resource changes the path and URI of all children. Note that the parent of this resource must be notified that the name has changed so that it finds the resource under the correct new URI when another request arrives. The easiest way to achieve this is by removing the resource before changing the name and adding it again after the name change.
        Specified by:
        setName in interface Resource
        Parameters:
        name - the new name

      • setObserveType

        public void setObserveType(CoAP.Type type)
        Sets the type of the notifications that will be sent. If set to null (default) the type matching the request will be used.
        Parameters:
        type - either CON, NON, or null for no changes by the framework
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if illegal types for notifications are passed

      • getObserverCount

        public int getObserverCount()
        Returns the number of observe relations that this resource has to CoAP clients.
        Returns:
        the observer count

      • changed

        public void changed()
        Notifies all CoAP clients that have established an observe relation with this resource that the state has changed by reprocessing their original request that has established the relation. The notification is done by the executor of this resource or on the executor of its parent or transitively ancestor. If no ancestor defines its own executor, the thread that has called this method performs the notification.
        See Also:
        changed(ObserveRelationFilter)

      • changed

        public void changed(ObserveRelationFilter filter)
        Notifies a filtered set of CoAP clients that have established an observe relation with this resource that the state has changed by reprocessing their original request that has established the relation. The notification is done by the executor of this resource or on the executor of its parent or transitively ancestor. If no ancestor defines its own executor, the thread that has called this method performs the notification.
        Parameters:
        filter - filter to select set of relations. null, if all clients should be notified.
        See Also:
        changed()

      • notifyObserverRelations

        protected void notifyObserverRelations(ObserveRelationFilter filter)
        Notifies all CoAP clients that have established an observe relation with this resource that the state has changed by reprocessing their original request that has established the relation.
        Parameters:
        filter - filter to select set of relations. null, if all clients should be notified.

      • execute

        public void execute(Runnable task)
        Execute an arbitrary task on the executor of this resource or the first parent that defines its own executor. If no parent defines an executor, the thread that calls this method executes the specified task.
        Parameters:
        task - the task

      • executeAndWait

        public void executeAndWait(Runnable task)
                    throws InterruptedException
        Execute an arbitrary task on the executor of this resource or the first parent that defines its own executor and wait until it the task is completed. If no parent defines an executor, the thread that calls this method executes the specified task.
        Parameters:
        task - the task
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - the interrupted exception

      • getEndpoints

        public List<Endpoint> getEndpoints()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Gets the endpoints this resource is bound to. As long as a resource is not added to a server, it should return an empty list. After a resource is added, it should return the endpoint list of its parent. The root of the server will than return the actual list of endpoints.
        Specified by:
        getEndpoints in interface Resource
        Returns:
        the endpoints
